definitions.definition: Situated close to, or even below, the ground or another normal reference plane; not high or lofty.
definitions.example: a low wall  a low shelf

definitions.definition: Of less than normal height; below the average or normal level from which elevation is measured.
definitions.example: a low bow

definitions.definition: Not high in status, esteem or rank, dignity, or quality. (Compare vulgar.)
definitions.example: Now that was low even for you!

definitions.definition: Humble, meek, not haughty.
Disparaging; assigning little value or excellence.
definitions.example: She had a low opinion of cats. He took a low view of dogs.

definitions.definition: Being a nadir, a bottom.
definitions.example: the low point in her career

definitions.definition: Depressed in mood, dejected, sad.
definitions.example: low spirits

definitions.definition: Lacking health or vitality, strength or vivacity; feeble; weak.
definitions.example: a low pulse

definitions.definition: Small, not high (in amount or quantity, value, force, energy, etc).
definitions.example: My credit union charges a low interest rate.   Jogging during a whiteout, with such low temperatures and low visibility, is dangerous.   The store sold bread at low prices, and milk at even lower prices.   The contractors gave a low estimate of the costs.   low cholesterol   a low voltage wire   a low number

definitions.definition: Simple in complexity or development; (in several set phrases) favoring simplicity; (see e.g. low church, Low Tory).
definitions.example: low protozoan animals, low cryptogamic plants, and other low organisms

definitions.definition: (in several set phrases) Being near the equator.
definitions.example: the low northern latitudes

definitions.definition: (acoustics) Grave in pitch, due to being produced by relatively slow vibrations (wave oscillations); flat.
definitions.example: Generally, European men have lower voices than their Indian counterparts.

definitions.definition: Quiet; soft; not loud.
definitions.example: They spoke in low voices so I would not hear what they were saying.

definitions.definition: Made with a relatively large opening between the tongue and the palate; made with (part of) the tongue positioned low in the mouth, relative to the palate.
Lesser in value than other cards, denominations, suits, etc.
definitions.example: a low card

definitions.definition: Not rich or seasoned; offering the minimum of nutritional requirements; plain, simple.
(of an automobile, gear, etc) Designed for a slow (or the slowest) speed.
definitions.example: low gear

definitions.definition: Close to the ground.
Of a pitch, at a lower frequency.
With a low voice or sound; not loudly; gently.
definitions.example: to speak low

definitions.definition: Under the usual price; at a moderate price; cheaply.
definitions.example: He sold his wheat low.

definitions.definition: In a low mean condition; humbly; meanly.
In a time approaching our own.
In a path near the equator, so that the declination is small, or near the horizon, so that the altitude is small; said of the heavenly bodies with reference to the diurnal revolution.
definitions.example: The moon runs low, i.e. comparatively near the horizon when on or near the meridian.

definitions.definition: To let descend by its own weight, as something suspended; to let down
definitions.example: lower a bucket into a well

definitions.definition: To pull down
definitions.example: to lower a flag

definitions.definition: To reduce the height of
definitions.example: lower a chimney or turret

definitions.definition: To depress as to direction
definitions.example: lower the aim of a gun

definitions.definition: To make less elevated
definitions.example: to lower one's ambition, aspirations, or hopes

definitions.definition: To reduce the degree, intensity, strength, etc., of
definitions.example: lower distilled liquors

definitions.definition: To bring down; to humble
definitions.example: lower one's pride

definitions.definition: (lower oneself) To humble oneself; to do something one considers to be beneath one's dignity.
definitions.example: I could never lower myself enough to buy second-hand clothes.

definitions.definition: To reduce (something) in value, amount, etc.
definitions.example: lower the interest rate

definitions.definition: To fall; to sink; to grow less; to diminish; to decrease
definitions.example: The river lowered as rapidly as it rose.

definitions.definition: To decrease in value, amount, etc.
To frown; to look sullen.
To be dark, gloomy, and threatening, as clouds; of the sky: to be covered with dark and threatening clouds; to show threatening signs of approach, as a tempest.
